metadata.comments: Configures Azure Policy exemptions, currenlty configured only for CIS Microsoft Azure Foundations Benchmark v1.3.0

metadata.description: Specify the name of the Azure Policy

properties.description:
Control: Enable multi-factor authentication for all user credentials who have access to Azure resources. 

Exemption: MFA is enforced by eAuth, but is not recognized by Azure.
properties.displayName: Ensure that multi-factor authentication is enabled

properties.description:
Control: Enable sensitive data encryption at rest using Customer Managed Keys rather than Microsoft Managed keys. 

Exemption: Per ISD, Platform Managed Keys over Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) does not pose a significant issue especially considering the NAC Mitigating Factors. Implementing CMKs incurs additional overhead of managing keys internally and thus potentially another attack vector with those keys getting lost or compromised.
properties.displayName: Storage accounts should use customer-managed key for encryption

properties.description:
Control: Client certificates allow for the app to request a certificate for incoming requests. Only clients that have a valid certificate will be able to reach the app. 

Exemption: Azure Front Door doesn't support client/mutual authentication. Azure Functions are not accessed directly, only internally from other Azure resources or through APIM.
properties.displayName: Ensure the web app has 'Client Certificates (Incoming client certificates)' set to 'On'
